member.name: T:Cadru.Scim.Filters.FilterExpression
member.summary: Represents an SCIM filter expression.
member.remarks: Each expression MUST contain an attribute name followed by an attribute operator and optional value. Multiple expressions MAY be combined using an .

member.name: T:Cadru.Scim.Filters.FilterExpressionFormatOptions
member.summary: Provides options to be used when formatting an .

member.name: P:Cadru.Scim.Filters.FilterExpressionFormatOptions.IncludeQuerySeparator
member.summary: To prepend the "?" query string separator, ; otherwise,

member.name: P:Cadru.Scim.Filters.FilterExpressionFormatOptions.IncludeFilterParameterName
member.summary: To prepend the "filter=" query string parameter key, ; otherwise,

member.name: T:Cadru.Scim.Filters.FilterExpressionOperator
member.summary: The expression operators.

member.name: M:Cadru.Scim.Filters.FilterExpressionOperator.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the structure.
member.param: The string value of the instance.

member.name: P:Cadru.Scim.Filters.FilterExpressionOperator.Contains
member.summary: The entire operator value must be a substring of the attribute value for a match.

member.name: P:Cadru.Scim.Filters.FilterExpressionOperator.EndsWith
member.summary: The entire operator value must be a substring of the attribute value, matching at the end of the attribute value.
member.remarks: This criterion is satisfied if the two strings are identical.

member.name: P:Cadru.Scim.Filters.FilterExpressionOperator.Equal
member.summary: The attribute and operator values must be identical for a match.

member.name: P:Cadru.Scim.Filters.FilterExpressionOperator.GreaterThan
member.summary: If the attribute value is greater than the operator value, there is a match.
member.remarks: The actual comparison is dependent on the attribute type. For string attribute types, this is a lexicographical comparison, and for DateTime types, it is a chronological comparison. For integer attributes, it is a comparison by numeric value. Boolean and Binary attributes will cause a failed response (HTTP status code 400) with "scimType" of "invalidFilter".

member.name: P:Cadru.Scim.Filters.FilterExpressionOperator.GreaterThanOrEqual
member.summary: If the attribute value is greater than or equal to the operator value, there is a match.
member.remarks: The actual comparison is dependent on the attribute type. For string attribute types, this is a lexicographical comparison, and for DateTime types, it is a chronological comparison. For integer attributes, it is a comparison by numeric value. Boolean and Binary attributes will cause a failed response (HTTP status code 400) with "scimType" of "invalidFilter".

member.name: P:Cadru.Scim.Filters.FilterExpressionOperator.HasValue
member.summary: If the attribute has a non-empty or non-null value, or if it contains a non-empty node for complex attributes, there is a match.

member.name: P:Cadru.Scim.Filters.FilterExpressionOperator.LessThan
member.summary: If the attribute value is less than the operator value, there is a match.
member.remarks: The actual comparison is dependent on the attribute type. For string attribute types, this is a lexicographical comparison, and for DateTime types, it is a chronological comparison. For integer attributes, it is a comparison by numeric value. Boolean and Binary attributes will cause a failed response (HTTP status code 400) with "scimType" of "invalidFilter".

member.name: P:Cadru.Scim.Filters.FilterExpressionOperator.LessThanOrEqual
member.summary: If the attribute value is less than or equal to the operator value, there is a match.
member.remarks: The actual comparison is dependent on the attribute type. For string attribute types, this is a lexicographical comparison, and for DateTime types, it is a chronological comparison. For integer attributes, it is a comparison by numeric value. Boolean and Binary attributes will cause a failed response (HTTP status code 400) with "scimType" of "invalidFilter".

member.name: P:Cadru.Scim.Filters.FilterExpressionOperator.NotEqual
member.summary: The attribute and operator values are not identical.

member.name: P:Cadru.Scim.Filters.FilterExpressionOperator.Present
member.summary: If the attribute has a non-empty or non-null value, or if it contains a non-empty node for complex attributes, there is a match.

member.name: P:Cadru.Scim.Filters.FilterExpressionOperator.StartsWith
member.summary: The entire operator value must be a substring of the attribute value, matching at the beginning of the attribute value.
member.remarks: This criterion is satisfied if the two strings are identical.

member.summary: Converts a string to a .

member.summary: Determines if two values are different.
member.returns: True if and are different; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Cadru.Scim.Filters.FilterExpressionOperator.op_Equality(Cadru.Scim.Filters.FilterExpressionOperator,Cadru.Scim.Filters.FilterExpressionOperator)
member.summary: Determines if two values are the same.
member.returns: True if and are the same; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Indicates the grouping character used by an .

member.name: F:Cadru.Scim.Filters.GroupingCharacter.None
member.summary: No grouping characters will be used.

member.name: F:Cadru.Scim.Filters.GroupingCharacter.Parentheses
member.summary: Boolean expressions may be grouped using parentheses to change the standard order of operations.

member.name: F:Cadru.Scim.Filters.GroupingCharacter.SquareBracket
member.summary: Service providers may support complex filters where expressions must be applied to the same value of a parent attribute. The expression with square brackets must be a valid filter expression based upon sub-attributes of the parent attribute. Nested expressions may be used.
